revisionDesc.change: Vote - AcceptText - See Berkes's comments. I think that <:(Ï€Î±ÏÎ±Î¼Ï…Î¸(Ã­Î±Ï‚))|alt|(Ï€Î±ÏÎ±Î¼(Ï…)Î¸(Î¯Î±Ï‚)):> is preferable now. Perhaps later it can be corrected on the basis of renewed checking of the image.

Text from printed edition. In line 2 the papyrus has Ï€Î±ÏÎ±Î¼Î¸ (Ï€Î±ÏÎ±Î¼+sign of abbreviation + elevated Î¸), as the editor writes in his apparatus and as can be confirmed from the photo. Thus, in my opinion, Ï€Î±ÏÎ±Î¼(Ï…)Î¸(Î¯Î±Ï‚) should be used here. I wasn't sure what was the best way to enter 1/4 fraction. The editor uses the latin d sign, which I've chosen to follow.
